contentrichtext.text: {{Nofootnotes|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Takahashi |JapaneseName= 高梁市 |settlement_type= [[Cities of Japan|City]] |MapImage= Map Takahashi en.png|thumb|250px|Map showing location of Takahashi in Okayama Prefecture (as of 2006) |Region= [[Chugoku region|Chugoku]] |Prefecture= [[Okayama Prefecture|Okayama]] |District= |ImageSkyline= View of Takahashi City, Okayama.jpg |ImageCaption= View of Downtown Takahashi, Okayama, from Atago Bridge |Area_km2= 547.01 |PopDate= April 30, 2011 |Population= 34,119 |Density_km2= 62.37 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 34 |LatitudeMinutes= 47 |LatitudeSeconds= 29 |LongtitudeDegrees= 133 |LongtitudeMinutes= 36 |LongtitudeSeconds= 59 |Tree= [[Pinus densiflora]] |Flower= [[Cherry blossom]] |Bird= [[Megaceryle lugubris]] |SymbolImage= Flag of Takahashi Okayama.JPG |SymbolDescription= Flag |Mayor= Takanori Kondo (since October 2010) |CityHallPostalCode= 716-8501 |CityHallAddress= 2043 Matsubara-dori, Takahashi-shi, Okayama-ken |CityHallPhone= 0866-23-1555 |CityHallLink= {{URL|http://www.city.takahashi.okayama.jp/}} }} {{nihongo|'''Takahashi'''|高梁市|Takahashi-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] in [[Okayama Prefecture]], Japan. [[File:Takahashi city office.jpg|thumb|Takahashi City Hall]] As of April 30, 2011, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 34,119, with 13,990 [[household]]s and a [[population density]] of 62.37 persons per km². The total area is 547.01 km². The city was founded on May 1, 1954. [[Bitchū Matsuyama Castle]] overlooks the town. Another significant location is [[Raikyū-ji]], a Buddhist temple with a historic garden. On October 1, 2004 Takahashi absorbed the town of [[Ukan, Okayama|Ukan]], from [[Jōbō District, Okayama|Jōbō District]], and the towns of [[Nariwa, Okayama|Nariwa]], [[Kawakami, Okayama (Kawakami)|Kawakami]], and [[Bitchū, Okayama|Bitchū]], all from [[Kawakami District, Okayama|Kawakami District]], to form the new city of Takahashi. [[Kawakami District, Okayama|Kawakami District]] was dissolved as a result of this merger. ==External links== {{Commons category}} * {{Wikivoyage-inline|Takahashi}} * [http://www.city.takahashi.okayama.jp/ Takahashi official website] {{ja icon}} {{Okayama}} [[Category:Cities in Okayama Prefecture]] {{Okayama-geo-stub}}
